title: WebhookLib Documentation
description: Production-Quality Discord Webhook Library for Roblox Server Environments

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: WebhookLib is a production-quality Discord webhook library specifically designed for Roblox Server environments. It provides a complete suite of features for sending Discord webhook messages including plain text and rich embed messages with automatic sanitization, player join/leave notifications with Roblox avatar thumbnails, optional automatic rate limiting and request queueing with exponential backoff, DataStore-backed join count tracking with in-memory caching, robust error handling with configurable retry logic, optional profanity filtering with custom word lists, comprehensive debugging and logging capabilities, and thread-safe operations that won't block the main game thread.

subsections.title: Key Features
subsections.content:
- **Production Ready**: Built for high-traffic games with robust error handling
- **Rate Limiting**: Optional automatic rate limiting with request queueing
- **Player Tracking**: Automatic join/leave notifications with avatar thumbnails
- **Rich Embeds**: Send beautiful Discord embeds with automatic sanitization
- **Thread Safe**: Non-blocking operations that won't freeze your game
- **DataStore Integration**: Persistent join count tracking
- **Profanity Filtering**: Optional content filtering with custom word lists
- **Comprehensive Logging**: Debug mode for troubleshooting

subsections.title: Requirements
subsections.content:
**Required Roblox Game Settings:**

1. Go to Game Settings > Security tab
2. Enable "Allow HTTP Requests" - This is REQUIRED for webhook functionality
3. Ensure DataStore API access is enabled (usually enabled by default)
4. For production games, consider enabling Studio API access for testing

sections.title: Getting Started
sections.content: This guide will help you set up WebhookLib in your Roblox game quickly and efficiently.

subsections.title: Installation
subsections.content:
1. Download the WebhookLib ModuleScript
2. Place it in ReplicatedStorage and name it "WebhookLib"
3. In a ServerScript, require the module:

```lua
local WebhookLib = require(game.ReplicatedStorage.WebhookLib)
```

subsections.title: Discord Webhook Setup
subsections.content:
**How to Obtain a Discord Webhook URL (Using the Proxy):**

1. In your Discord server, go to Server Settings > Integrations > Webhooks
2. Click New Webhook or Create Webhook
3. Set the webhook name, avatar, and target channel
4. Copy the webhook URL (format: https://discord.com/api/webhooks/ID/TOKEN)
5. Open https://webhook.lewisakura.moe/
6. Paste your normal Discord webhook URL and convert it
7. You will get a new URL in the format: https://webhook.lewisakura.moe/api/webhooks/ID/TOKEN
8. Use this new URL in your Roblox script instead of the normal Discord link
9. **Keep this URL secure** ‚Äì anyone with access can send messages to your Discord

subsections.title: Minimal Setup
subsections.content:
Here's the absolute minimum code needed to get started:

```lua
local WebhookLib = require(game.ReplicatedStorage.WebhookLib)
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("YOUR_WEBHOOK_URL_HERE")

-- Send a test message
webhook:SendMessage("Hello from Roblox!")

-- Optional: Connect player events
game.Players.PlayerAdded:Connect(function(player)
    webhook:SendJoinMessage(player)
end)

game.Players.PlayerRemoving:Connect(function(player)
    webhook:SendLeaveMessage(player)
end)
```

subsections.title: Configuration Options
subsections.content:
WebhookLib supports extensive configuration. All options are optional and have sensible defaults:

```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("YOUR_WEBHOOK_URL", {
    username = "My Game Bot",
    avatar_url = "https://example.com/avatar.png",
    default_color = 0x0099ff,
    queue_enabled = false, -- Only enable if needed
    queue_rate_limit = nil, -- Set to enable rate limiting
    filter_profanity = false,
    debug = false,
    max_retries = 3,
    retry_backoff_base = 1,
    cache_ttl_avatar = 300,
    datastore_name = "WebhookLib_JoinCounts",
    banned_words = {"custom", "words"}
})
```

sections.title: Configuration
sections.content: WebhookLib offers extensive configuration options to suit different game requirements. All configuration is done during initialization.

subsections.title: Basic Configuration
subsections.content:
The most commonly used configuration options:

```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("YOUR_WEBHOOK_URL", {
    username = "My Game Bot", -- Default webhook username
    avatar_url = "https://example.com/avatar.png", -- Default avatar
    default_color = 0x0099ff, -- Default embed color (hex)
    debug = true -- Enable debug logging
})
```

**Configuration Options:**
- `username` (string): Default username for webhook messages
- `avatar_url` (string): Default avatar URL for webhook messages
- `default_color` (number): Default color for embeds (hex format)
- `debug` (boolean): Enable detailed logging for troubleshooting

subsections.title: Queue and Rate Limiting
subsections.content:
For high-traffic games, you can enable request queueing and rate limiting:

```lua
-- Enable queue without rate limiting
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("YOUR_WEBHOOK_URL", {
    queue_enabled = true
})

-- Enable queue with rate limiting
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("YOUR_WEBHOOK_URL", {
    queue_rate_limit = 2 -- 2 requests per second
    -- queue_enabled is automatically set to true
})
```

**Queue Options:**
- `queue_enabled` (boolean): Enable request queueing (default: false)
- `queue_rate_limit` (number): Requests per second limit (automatically enables queue)

**When to Use Queueing:**
- High-traffic games with many webhook calls
- Games that send player notifications for large player counts
- When you want to prevent Discord rate limiting

**Note:** Only enable queueing if your game actually needs it. For most games, the default immediate sending is sufficient.

subsections.title: Error Handling and Retries
subsections.content:
Configure how WebhookLib handles failed requests:

```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("YOUR_WEBHOOK_URL", {
    max_retries = 5, -- Retry failed requests up to 5 times
    retry_backoff_base = 2 -- Base delay for exponential backoff
})
```

**Retry Options:**
- `max_retries` (number): Maximum number of retry attempts (default: 3)
- `retry_backoff_base` (number): Base delay in seconds for exponential backoff (default: 1)

**How Retries Work:**
- Failed requests are automatically retried with exponential backoff
- Delay increases: 1s, 2s, 4s, 8s, etc. (capped at 60 seconds)
- Different handling for rate limits vs. server errors
- Client errors (4xx) are not retried

subsections.title: Content Filtering
subsections.content:
Enable profanity filtering and add custom banned words:

```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("YOUR_WEBHOOK_URL", {
    filter_profanity = true,
    banned_words = {"spam", "advertisement", "custom", "words"}
})
```

**Filter Options:**
- `filter_profanity` (boolean): Enable profanity filtering (default: false)
- `banned_words` (array): Custom words to add to the default banned words list

**Default Banned Words:**
`"noob", "trash", "garbage", "stupid", "idiot", "loser", "fail"`

**How Filtering Works:**
- Banned words are replaced with asterisks (*)
- Filtering applies to message content and embed fields
- Case-insensitive matching
- Punctuation is ignored during matching

subsections.title: Caching and DataStore
subsections.content:
Configure avatar caching and DataStore settings:

```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("YOUR_WEBHOOK_URL", {
    cache_ttl_avatar = 600, -- Cache avatars for 10 minutes
    datastore_name = "MyGame_WebhookData" -- Custom DataStore name
})
```

**Caching Options:**
- `cache_ttl_avatar` (number): Avatar cache time-to-live in seconds (default: 300)
- `datastore_name` (string): Custom DataStore name for join counts (default: "WebhookLib_JoinCounts")

**Avatar Caching:**
- Player avatars are cached to reduce API calls
- Cache is automatically cleaned when TTL expires
- Fallback to default avatar if fetch fails

**DataStore Usage:**
- Stores player join counts persistently
- Automatic retry logic for DataStore operations
- Graceful fallback if DataStore is unavailable

sections.title: API Reference
sections.content: Complete reference for all WebhookLib methods and their parameters.

subsections.title: Constructor
subsections.content:
### WebhookLib.new(url, options)

Creates a new WebhookLib instance.

**Parameters:**
- `url` (string, required): Discord webhook URL
- `options` (table, optional): Configuration options

**Returns:**
- WebhookLib instance

**Example:**
```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("https://discord.com/api/webhooks/...", {
    username = "My Bot",
    debug = true
})
```

**Throws:**
- Error if URL is invalid or missing

subsections.title: Sending Messages
subsections.content:
### SendMessage(content, overrides)

Sends a plain text message to Discord.

**Parameters:**
- `content` (string, required): Message content (max 2000 characters)
- `overrides` (table, optional): Override default username/avatar for this message

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if queued successfully, false on error

**Example:**
```lua
-- Basic message
webhook:SendMessage("Hello Discord!")

-- With overrides
webhook:SendMessage("Admin announcement!", {
    username = "Admin Bot",
    avatar_url = "https://example.com/admin-avatar.png"
})
```

**Notes:**
- Content is automatically filtered if profanity filtering is enabled
- Long messages are truncated to Discord's 2000 character limit
- Returns immediately (message is queued or sent asynchronously)

subsections.title: Rich Embeds
subsections.content:
### SendEmbed(embedTable)

Sends a rich embed message to Discord.

**Parameters:**
- `embedTable` (table, required): Discord embed structure

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if queued successfully, false on error

**Example:**
```lua
webhook:SendEmbed({
    title = "üèÜ Game Statistics",
    description = "Current server statistics",
    color = 0x0099ff,
    fields = {
        {name = "Players Online", value = "15", inline = true},
        {name = "Server Uptime", value = "2 hours", inline = true}
    },
    thumbnail = {
        url = "https://example.com/thumbnail.png"
    },
    footer = {
        text = "Automated Report"
    },
    timestamp = os.date("!%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
})
```

**Embed Structure:**
- `title` (string): Embed title (max 256 characters)
- `description` (string): Embed description (max 4096 characters)
- `color` (number): Embed color in hex format
- `fields` (array): Array of field objects
- `thumbnail` (object): Thumbnail image
- `footer` (object): Footer text and icon
- `timestamp` (string): ISO 8601 timestamp

**Automatic Sanitization:**
- All text fields are filtered for profanity
- Long text is automatically truncated
- Invalid fields are removed

subsections.title: Multiple Embeds
Player Notifications
subsections.content:
### SendJoinMessage(player)

Sends an automatic join notification with player information.

**Parameters:**
- `player` (Player, required): Roblox Player instance

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if queued successfully, false on error

**Example:**
```lua
game.Players.PlayerAdded:Connect(function(player)
    pcall(function() -- Always wrap in pcall for production
        webhook:SendJoinMessage(player)
    end)
end)
```

### SendLeaveMessage(player)

Sends an automatic leave notification with player information.

**Parameters:**
- `player` (Player, required): Roblox Player instance

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if queued successfully, false on error

**Example:**
```lua
game.Players.PlayerRemoving:Connect(function(player)
    pcall(function()
        webhook:SendLeaveMessage(player)
    end)
end)
```

**Features of Player Notifications:**
- Automatic player avatar fetching and caching
- Join count tracking with DataStore persistence
- Rich embed with player information:
  - Username and Display Name
  - User ID and Account Age
  - Join count and current player count
  - Player avatar thumbnail
- Automatic error handling and retries

subsections.title: Custom Events
subsections.content:
### SendCustomEvent(name, data)

Sends a custom event notification with structured data.

**Parameters:**
- `name` (string, required): Event name/title
- `data` (table, optional): Key-value pairs of event data

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if queued successfully, false on error

**Example:**
```lua
webhook:SendCustomEvent("üéØ Player Achievement", {
    ["Player"] = "john_doe",
    ["Achievement"] = "First Victory!",
    ["Score"] = "9,999",
    ["Time"] = os.date("%c"),
    ["Difficulty"] = "Hard Mode"
})
```

**Features:**
- Automatically creates embed with event data
- Supports up to 25 fields per event
- All data is converted to strings and sanitized
- Timestamp is automatically added
- Uses default embed color

subsections.title: Configuration Methods
subsections.content:
### SetWebhookUrl(url)

Updates the webhook URL.

**Parameters:**
- `url` (string, required): New webhook URL

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if successful, false on error

### SetDefaultUsername(username)

Updates the default username for webhook messages.

**Parameters:**
- `username` (string, required): New default username

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if successful, false on error

### SetDefaultAvatarUrl(avatarUrl)

Updates the default avatar URL for webhook messages.

**Parameters:**
- `avatarUrl` (string, required): New default avatar URL

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if successful, false on error

### SetDefaultColor(color)

Updates the default color for embeds.

**Parameters:**
- `color` (number, required): New default color in hex format (0x000000 to 0xFFFFFF)

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if successful, false on error

**Example:**
```lua
webhook:SetDefaultUsername("ü§ñ Game Bot v2.0")
webhook:SetDefaultColor(0xff6600) -- Orange
webhook:SetDefaultAvatarUrl("https://example.com/new-avatar.png")
```

subsections.title: Queue Management
subsections.content:
### EnableQueue(enabled, rateLimit)

Enables or disables the request queue system at runtime.

**Parameters:**
- `enabled` (boolean, required): Enable or disable queue
- `rateLimit` (number, optional): Requests per second limit

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if successful

### GetQueueSize()

Gets the current number of pending requests in the queue.

**Returns:**
- `number`: Number of requests in queue

### IsQueueEnabled()

Checks if the queue system is currently enabled.

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if queue is enabled, false otherwise

**Example:**
```lua
-- Enable queue with rate limiting
webhook:EnableQueue(true, 3) -- 3 requests per second

-- Check queue status
print("Queue enabled:", webhook:IsQueueEnabled())
print("Queue size:", webhook:GetQueueSize())

-- Disable queue
webhook:EnableQueue(false)
```

subsections.title: Utility Methods
subsections.content:
### EnableDebug(enabled)

Enables or disables debug logging at runtime.

**Parameters:**
- `enabled` (boolean, required): Enable or disable debug logging

**Returns:**
- `boolean`: true if successful

### GetConfiguration()

Returns a copy of the current configuration.

**Returns:**
- `table`: Deep copy of current configuration

### Shutdown()

Gracefully shuts down the webhook system, waiting for pending requests to complete.

**Returns:**
- `void`

**Example:**
```lua
-- Enable debug logging
webhook:EnableDebug(true)

-- Get current config
local config = webhook:GetConfiguration()
print("Current username:", config.username)

-- Graceful shutdown (important for server closing)
game:BindToClose(function()
    print("Shutting down webhook...")
    webhook:Shutdown()
    wait(2) -- Give it time to complete
end)
```

**Notes:**
- `Shutdown()` waits up to 10 seconds for pending requests
- Always call `Shutdown()` in `game:BindToClose()` for production games
- Debug logging should be disabled in production for better performance

sections.title: Usage Examples
sections.content: Comprehensive examples showing different ways to use WebhookLib in real-world scenarios.

subsections.title: Basic Setup Examples
subsections.content:
### Minimal Setup (No Queue, No Rate Limiting)

```lua
local WebhookLib = require(game.ReplicatedStorage.WebhookLib)
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("https://discord.com/api/webhooks/YOUR_ID/YOUR_TOKEN")

-- This sends messages immediately without queueing
webhook:SendMessage("üéÆ Server started!")
```

### With Queue Enabled (No Rate Limiting)

```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("https://discord.com/api/webhooks/YOUR_ID/YOUR_TOKEN", {
    username = "My Game Bot",
    queue_enabled = true, -- Enables queueing but no rate limiting
    debug = true
})
```

### With Queue and Rate Limiting

```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("https://discord.com/api/webhooks/YOUR_ID/YOUR_TOKEN", {
    username = "üéÆ My Awesome Game",
    debug = true,
    queue_rate_limit = 2, -- 2 requests per second (automatically enables queue)
    filter_profanity = true,
    default_color = 0x0099ff,
    banned_words = {"custom", "bad", "words"} -- Adds to default list
})
```

### Enable Queue at Runtime

```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("https://discord.com/api/webhooks/YOUR_ID/YOUR_TOKEN")
webhook:EnableQueue(true, 1) -- Enable queue with 1 request per second
```

subsections.title: Message Examples
Player Event Tracking
Game Event Monitoring
subsections.content:
### Server Health Monitoring

```lua
-- Memory usage alert
local function checkServerHealth()
    local memoryUsage = game:GetService("Stats"):GetTotalMemoryUsageMb()
    
    if memoryUsage > 500 then -- Alert if memory usage is high
        webhook:SendEmbed({
            title = "‚ö†Ô∏è High Memory Usage Alert",
            description = "Server memory usage is critically high",
            color = 0xff4444,
            fields = {
                {name = "Memory Usage", value = string.format("%.1f MB", memoryUsage), inline = true},
                {name = "Players Online", value = tostring(#game.Players:GetPlayers()), inline = true},
                {name = "Uptime", value = tostring(math.floor(workspace.DistributedGameTime / 60)) .. " minutes", inline = true}
            },
            timestamp = os.date("!%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
        })
    end
end

-- Check every 5 minutes
game:GetService("RunService").Heartbeat:Connect(function()
    if workspace.DistributedGameTime % 300 < 1 then -- Every 5 minutes
        checkServerHealth()
    end
end)
```

### Game Round System

```lua
-- Round start notification
local function onRoundStart(roundNumber, mapName)
    webhook:SendEmbed({
        title = "üéÆ Round Started",
        description = string.format("Round %d has begun!", roundNumber),
        color = 0x00ff00,
        fields = {
            {name = "Round Number", value = tostring(roundNumber), inline = true},
            {name = "Map", value = mapName, inline = true},
            {name = "Players", value = tostring(#game.Players:GetPlayers()), inline = true}
        }
    })
end

-- Round end with statistics
local function onRoundEnd(winner, roundTime, stats)
    webhook:SendEmbed({
        title = "üèÜ Round Complete",
        description = string.format("**%s** won the round!", winner),
        color = 0xffd700,
        fields = {
            {name = "Winner", value = winner, inline = true},
            {name = "Round Time", value = string.format("%d:%02d", math.floor(roundTime/60), roundTime%60), inline = true},
            {name = "Players", value = tostring(stats.totalPlayers), inline = true},
            {name = "Eliminations", value = tostring(stats.eliminations), inline = true}
        }
    })
end
```

subsections.title: Error Handling and Production Practices
subsections.content:
### Production-Ready Error Handling

```lua
local function setupWebhook()
    local success, webhook = pcall(function()
        return WebhookLib.new("https://discord.com/api/webhooks/YOUR_ID/YOUR_TOKEN", {
            username = "üéÆ Production Game",
            debug = false,
            filter_profanity = true,
            queue_rate_limit = 2, -- Prevent rate limiting
            max_retries = 5
        })
    end)
    
    if success then
        print("WebhookLib initialized successfully")
        return webhook
    else
        warn("Failed to initialize WebhookLib:", webhook)
        return nil
    end
end

local webhook = setupWebhook()
if webhook then
    -- Safe message sending
    pcall(function()
        webhook:SendMessage("üöÄ Production server started successfully!")
    end)
end
```

### Graceful Shutdown

```lua
-- Graceful shutdown handling
game:BindToClose(function()
    if webhook then
        print("Shutting down webhook...")
        
        -- Send final message
        pcall(function()
            webhook:SendMessage("üõë Server shutting down...")
        end)
        
        -- Wait for pending requests
        webhook:Shutdown()
        wait(2) -- Give it time to complete
        
        print("Webhook shutdown complete")
    end
end)
```

### Batch Operations for Performance

```lua
-- Instead of sending individual messages for each player
-- Batch player information into a single embed
local function sendPlayerSummary()
    local players = game.Players:GetPlayers()
    local fields = {}
    
    for i, player in ipairs(players) do
        if i > 25 then break end -- Discord embed field limit
        table.insert(fields, {
            name = player.DisplayName,
            value = string.format("ID: %d | Age: %dd", player.UserId, player.AccountAge),
            inline = true
        })
    end
    
    webhook:SendEmbed({
        title = "üë• Current Players",
        description = string.format("%d players currently online", #players),
        color = 0x0099ff,
        fields = fields,
        timestamp = os.date("!%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
    })
end
```

subsections.title: Runtime Configuration Management
subsections.content:
### Dynamic Configuration Changes

```lua
-- Create webhook with initial settings
local webhook = WebhookLib.new("https://discord.com/api/webhooks/YOUR_ID/YOUR_TOKEN", {
    username = "ü§ñ Game Bot",
    debug = true
})

-- Update settings at runtime
webhook:SetDefaultUsername("ü§ñ Game Bot v2.0")
webhook:SetDefaultColor(0xff6600) -- Change to orange
webhook:EnableQueue(true, 3) -- Enable queue with 3 requests/second
webhook:EnableDebug(false) -- Disable debug for production

-- Monitor queue status
local function monitorQueue()
    print("Queue enabled:", webhook:IsQueueEnabled())
    print("Queue size:", webhook:GetQueueSize())
end

-- Check configuration
local config = webhook:GetConfiguration()
print("Current username:", config.username)
print("Rate limit:", config.queue_rate_limit)
print("Debug mode:", config.debug)
```

### Environment-Based Configuration

```lua
-- Different settings for different environments
local function createWebhook(environment)
    local configs = {
        development = {
            username = "üîß Dev Bot",
            debug = true,
            queue_enabled = false, -- Immediate sending for testing
            filter_profanity = false
        },
        production = {
            username = "üéÆ Game Bot",
            debug = false,
            queue_rate_limit = 2,
            filter_profanity = true,
            max_retries = 5
        }
    }
    
    local config = configs[environment] or configs.production
    return WebhookLib.new("https://discord.com/api/webhooks/YOUR_ID/YOUR_TOKEN", config)
end

-- Usage
local webhook = createWebhook("production")
```

sections.title: Best Practices
sections.content: Guidelines and recommendations for using WebhookLib effectively in production environments.

subsections.title: Production Deployment
subsections.content:
**Essential Production Practices:**

1. **Always Use pcall() for Webhook Calls**
```lua
-- GOOD: Safe webhook calls
game.Players.PlayerAdded:Connect(function(player)
    pcall(function()
        webhook:SendJoinMessage(player)
    end)
end)

-- BAD: Unprotected calls can crash your server
game.Players.PlayerAdded:Connect(function(player)
    webhook:SendJoinMessage(player) -- Could throw error
end)
```

2. **Disable Debug Mode in Production**
```lua
-- Production configuration
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {
    debug = false, -- Important for performance
    username = "üéÆ Production Game",
    filter_profanity = true
})
```

3. **Implement Graceful Shutdown**
```lua
game:BindToClose(function()
    if webhook then
        webhook:SendMessage("üõë Server shutting down...")
        webhook:Shutdown()
        wait(2) -- Give time to complete
    end
end)
```

4. **Use Environment Variables for URLs**
- Never hardcode webhook URLs in your scripts
- Store URLs in secure configuration systems
- Use different webhooks for different environments

subsections.title: Performance Optimization
subsections.content:
**Queue System Guidelines:**

- **Only enable queueing for high-traffic games**
- Most games don't need rate limiting
- Enable queue only if you're hitting Discord rate limits

```lua
-- Low traffic game (most games)
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url) -- No queue needed

-- High traffic game (100+ players, frequent events)
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {
    queue_rate_limit = 5 -- 5 requests per second
})
```

**Caching Optimization:**

```lua
-- Adjust cache TTL based on your needs
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {
    cache_ttl_avatar = 1800, -- 30 minutes for high-traffic games
    -- cache_ttl_avatar = 300, -- 5 minutes for low-traffic games
})
```

**Batch Operations:**

```lua
-- Instead of multiple individual messages
-- Combine information into fewer, richer messages
local function sendHourlyReport()
    local stats = collectHourlyStats()
    
    webhook:SendEmbed({
        title = "üìä Hourly Report",
        fields = {
            {name = "New Players", value = tostring(stats.newPlayers)},
            {name = "Revenue", value = "$" .. stats.revenue},
            {name = "Playtime", value = stats.totalPlaytime .. " hours"}
        }
    })
end
```

subsections.title: Security Considerations
subsections.content:
**Webhook URL Security:**

- **Never** commit webhook URLs to version control
- Use secure configuration management
- Rotate webhook URLs periodically
- Monitor webhook usage for unauthorized access

**Content Filtering:**

```lua
-- Always enable profanity filtering for user-generated content
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {
    filter_profanity = true,
    banned_words = {
        "spam", "advertisement", "discord.gg", "robux"
    }
})
```

**Input Validation:**

```lua
-- Validate user input before sending
local function sendPlayerMessage(player, message)
    -- Validate input
    if not player or not message or message:len() > 100 then
        return false
    end
    
    -- Additional validation
    if message:match("http") or message:match("discord.gg") then
        return false
    end
    
    -- Safe to send
    pcall(function()
        webhook:SendCustomEvent("Player Message", {
            Player = player.DisplayName,
            Message = message
        })
    end)
end
```

subsections.title: Error Handling Strategies
subsections.content:
**Comprehensive Error Handling:**

```lua
-- Create error-resistant webhook setup
local function createRobustWebhook(url)
    local success, webhook = pcall(function()
        return WebhookLib.new(url, {
            max_retries = 5,
            retry_backoff_base = 2,
            debug = game.PlaceId == 0 -- Debug only in Studio
        })
    end)
    
    if not success then
        warn("WebhookLib initialization failed:", webhook)
        return nil
    end
    
    return webhook
end

-- Usage with fallback
local webhook = createRobustWebhook(PRIMARY_WEBHOOK_URL)
if not webhook then
    webhook = createRobustWebhook(BACKUP_WEBHOOK_URL)
end
```

**Fallback Systems:**

```lua
-- Multiple webhook fallback
local webhooks = {
    createRobustWebhook(PRIMARY_URL),
    createRobustWebhook(SECONDARY_URL)
}

-- Remove failed webhooks
for i = #webhooks, 1, -1 do
    if not webhooks[i] then
        table.remove(webhooks, i)
    end
end

-- Send to available webhooks
local function sendToWebhooks(message)
    for _, webhook in ipairs(webhooks) do
        pcall(function()
            webhook:SendMessage(message)
        end)
    end
end
```

**Logging and Monitoring:**

```lua
-- Track webhook health
local webhookStats = {
    messagesSent = 0,
    errors = 0,
    lastError = nil
}

local function safeWebhookCall(func)
    local success, error = pcall(func)
    
    if success then
        webhookStats.messagesSent = webhookStats.messagesSent + 1
    else
        webhookStats.errors = webhookStats.errors + 1
        webhookStats.lastError = {error, os.time()}
        warn("Webhook error:", error)
    end
end

-- Usage
safeWebhookCall(function()
    webhook:SendMessage("Test message")
end)
```

subsections.title: Content Guidelines
subsections.content:
**Message Design Best Practices:**

1. **Use Meaningful Titles and Descriptions**
```lua
-- GOOD: Clear, informative
webhook:SendEmbed({
    title = "üéØ Daily Challenge Complete",
    description = "Player completed today's daily challenge"
})

-- BAD: Vague, unclear
webhook:SendEmbed({
    title = "Event",
    description = "Something happened"
})
```

2. **Use Consistent Color Coding**
```lua
local COLORS = {
    SUCCESS = 0x00ff00, -- Green for positive events
    WARNING = 0xffaa00, -- Orange for warnings
    ERROR = 0xff0000,   -- Red for errors
    INFO = 0x0099ff     -- Blue for information
}

webhook:SendEmbed({
    title = "‚ö†Ô∏è High Memory Usage",
    color = COLORS.WARNING
})
```

3. **Limit Message Frequency**
```lua
-- Rate limit notifications to prevent spam
local lastNotification = 0
local NOTIFICATION_COOLDOWN = 300 -- 5 minutes

local function sendCriticalAlert(message)
    local now = os.time()
    if now - lastNotification > NOTIFICATION_COOLDOWN then
        webhook:SendMessage("üö® " .. message)
        lastNotification = now
    end
end
```

4. **Use Rich Formatting**
```lua
-- Leverage Discord's markdown formatting
webhook:SendEmbed({
    title = "üìä Server Statistics",
    description = "Current server performance metrics",
    fields = {
        {
            name = "**Performance**", 
            value = "```\nCPU: 15%\nMemory: 450MB\nPlayers: 25/50\n```",
            inline = false
        }
    }
})
```

sections.title: Troubleshooting
sections.content: Common issues and their solutions when using WebhookLib.

subsections.title: Common Setup Issues
subsections.content:
**"HTTP requests are disabled in game settings"**

*Solution:*
1. Go to Roblox Studio > Game Settings > Security
2. Check "Allow HTTP Requests"
3. Save and republish your game
4. Restart the server

**"WebhookLib.new() requires a valid webhook URL string"**

*Causes and Solutions:*
- Empty or nil URL parameter
- Incorrect webhook URL format
- Using Roblox proxy incorrectly

```lua
-- CORRECT: Using webhook proxy
local url = "https://webhook.lewisakura.moe/api/webhooks/ID/TOKEN"

-- INCORRECT: Direct Discord URL (blocked by Roblox)
local url = "https://discord.com/api/webhooks/ID/TOKEN"
```

**"ModuleScript not found"**

*Solution:*
1. Ensure WebhookLib is in ReplicatedStorage
2. Name it exactly "WebhookLib"
3. Require it correctly:

```lua
local WebhookLib = require(game.ReplicatedStorage.WebhookLib)
```

subsections.title: Message Sending Issues
subsections.content:
**Messages not appearing in Discord**

*Troubleshooting steps:*
1. Enable debug mode to see detailed logs:

```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {debug = true})
```

2. Check for HTTP errors in output:
   - HTTP 429: Rate limited (enable queue system)
   - HTTP 404: Invalid webhook URL
   - HTTP 403: Webhook deleted or permissions changed

3. Verify webhook URL is working:

```lua
-- Test with minimal message
webhook:SendMessage("Test message")
```

**Rate Limiting Issues**

*Symptoms:*
- "HTTP 429" errors in debug logs
- Messages delayed or not sent
- "Discord rate limit detected" messages

*Solutions:*

```lua
-- Enable queue with rate limiting
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {
    queue_rate_limit = 2, -- 2 requests per second
    debug = true
})

-- Or enable queue without rate limiting
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {
    queue_enabled = true
})
```

**Embed Formatting Issues**

*Common problems:*
- Text truncation (automatic, this is normal)
- Fields not appearing (check field structure)
- Colors not showing (use hex format: 0xFFFFFF)

```lua
-- Correct embed structure
webhook:SendEmbed({
    title = "Title Here", -- String
    color = 0x0099ff,    -- Number in hex format
    fields = {           -- Array of objects
        {
            name = "Field Name",   -- String (required)
            value = "Field Value", -- String (required)
            inline = true          -- Boolean (optional)
        }
    }
})
```

subsections.title: Performance Issues
subsections.content:
**Game Lag or Freezing**

*Causes:*
- Blocking HTTP requests (WebhookLib is non-blocking by design)
- Too many simultaneous webhook calls
- Debug mode enabled in production

*Solutions:*

```lua
-- GOOD: Non-blocking, safe calls
pcall(function()
    webhook:SendMessage("Message")
end)

-- GOOD: Disable debug in production
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {
    debug = false -- Important for performance
})

-- GOOD: Use queue for high-traffic games
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {
    queue_rate_limit = 3 -- Limit requests
})
```

**Memory Usage Issues**

*Causes:*
- Large avatar cache
- Long-running queues
- Not calling Shutdown() properly

*Solutions:*

```lua
-- Reduce avatar cache time
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {
    cache_ttl_avatar = 300 -- 5 minutes instead of default
})

-- Proper shutdown
game:BindToClose(function()
    webhook:Shutdown()
    wait(2)
end)
```

**Queue Building Up**

*Check queue size:*

```lua
print("Queue size:", webhook:GetQueueSize())
```

*Solutions:*
- Increase rate limit if too restrictive
- Check for network connectivity issues
- Verify webhook URL is still valid

subsections.title: DataStore Issues
subsections.content:
**Join Count Not Saving**

*Symptoms:*
- Join counts always show 0 or 1
- "DataStore not available" in debug logs

*Solutions:*

1. **Check DataStore Access:**
   - Ensure game is published (DataStores don't work in unpublished places)
   - Verify DataStore API is enabled in game settings

2. **Check for DataStore Errors:**

```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {debug = true})
-- Look for DataStore error messages in output
```

3. **Custom DataStore Name:**

```lua
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {
    datastore_name = "MyGame_PlayerData" -- Use unique name
})
```

**DataStore Request Limits**

*Symptoms:*
- "Request was throttled" errors
- Join counts not updating consistently

*Solutions:*
- WebhookLib automatically handles DataStore throttling
- Reduce frequency of join count queries if needed
- The system uses in-memory caching to minimize DataStore calls

subsections.title: Debug and Monitoring
subsections.content:
**Enable Comprehensive Debugging**

```lua
-- Enable all debugging features
local webhook = WebhookLib.new(url, {
    debug = true, -- Detailed logs
    max_retries = 1 -- Fail faster for testing
})

-- Monitor webhook health
local function checkWebhookHealth()
    print("=== Webhook Health Check ===")
    print("Queue enabled:", webhook:IsQueueEnabled())
    print("Queue size:", webhook:GetQueueSize())
    
    local config = webhook:GetConfiguration()
    print("Username:", config.username)
    print("Debug mode:", config.debug)
    print("Max retries:", config.max_retries)
    print("Rate limit:", config.queue_rate_limit or "None")
end

-- Run health check every minute
game:GetService("RunService").Heartbeat:Connect(function()
    if workspace.DistributedGameTime % 60 < 1 then
        checkWebhookHealth()
    end
end)
```

**Test Individual Features**

```lua
-- Test basic message
local success = webhook:SendMessage("Test basic message")
print("Basic message queued:", success)

-- Test embed
local success = webhook:SendEmbed({
    title = "Test Embed",
    description = "Testing embed functionality",
    color = 0x00ff00
})
print("Embed queued:", success)

-- Test configuration changes
print("Original username:", webhook:GetConfiguration().username)
webhook:SetDefaultUsername("Test Bot")
print("New username:", webhook:GetConfiguration().username)
```

**Network Connectivity Testing**

```lua
-- Test basic HTTP connectivity
local HttpService = game:GetService("HttpService")

local function testHttpConnectivity()
    local success, result = pcall(function()
        return HttpService:GetAsync("https://httpbin.org/get")
    end)
    
    print("HTTP connectivity:", success and "OK" or "FAILED")
    if not success then
        print("Error:", result)
    end
end

testHttpConnectivity()
```
